11111111.content:
The guy following you home, James, will not stop talking about how cool you are! It very much seems that he likes you, and to tell you the truth, you're pretty interested in him yourself. As he compliments you, you imagine yourself and James holding hands and going for a walk. In your fantasy, you stop, stare into each other's eyes, and his lips begin to move towards yours...

"AAAHHHHH!"

"What? What's the matter? What is it?" James asks, worried.

"Nothing... I, um, got my hair caught in my helmet and it suprised me. You unlatch and remove your helmet. "There, no problem now."

As James resumes talking about you, you remember the way you just felt. Now, just having a fantasy about you and James seems so horrifficly... wrong. You wonder why you have had this sudden change of heart. Then, as you think, you realize... You used to be James' best friend. Now why were you friends again, James acts like this is the first time he's met you. As you struggle to get your thoughts in order, it all comes back in a flash. Your little sister put you this way. She forced you into this situation. You are shocked that you momentarily forgot all this, and realize that female passions and hormones are much stronger than you thought. You will have to really work if you want to not completely forget who you were- are you remind yourself. You don't intend to stay this way forever.

"We're home," James announces, interrupting your thoughts. "It was nice talkin with you."

"Um, thanks. You too." You do feel affection at this, after all, he is cute, and it was so sweet of him to walk you- No. You need to get a grip on yourself.

"Oh- um, can I have your number?" The words spill from your lips before you realize what you just said. Half a second later, you curse yourself inwardly.

"Absolutely. 481-5162. Definitely text me soon."

You begrudgingly give him your sister's cell phone number, as your real number is already in James' phone, and the last thing you need is awkward questions. One thing is clear; you plan to make sure James never, ever finds out how his best friend got turned into a girl by his little sister.

At last, James leaves and you enter your house. You immediately decide you must get Sarah to change you back. But which is the best way to do it?

You enter the house and head up the stairs, only to see your sister coming down the stairs.
"Tell me everything," she practically squeals.
"What?" you ask.
"I was watching you talking with James---I saw you give him your cell phone number."
"Sis--"
"Tell me all about it."
"It was weird, it was like---"
"Yeah?" Obviously this eight year old wants to know the whole scoop. "Are you gonna see him again."

"What?" Sarah stops cold.
"I need you to change me back."
"I thought you liked the idea of being a big sister."
"I do--" You feel some warmth towards Sarah, and you remember how just this morning, you were so happy to be a girl, how natural it was. "Sarah".
She looks up at you, looking cute as a button and your heart almost breaks. You smile down at her.
"At least tell me what it was like first."
Surely this isn't too much to ask, and so you go upstairs together and sit on her bed. You talk about the boys and how you impressed them with your killer moves.

"I---" suddenly you have your doubts. You had a lot of fun---and your a better boarder as a girl which is an added bonus. "But he has my phone number...as a guy."
"No he doesn't, remember, right now only you and I remember you as a boy. You're not in his cell or anything. Just call him and explain the mix up."
"Then I can date him?"

"Sarah, you're the best sister ever!" You are so glad, you give your sister a hug.
"Glad I could help, and if you have anymore doubts, come to me, promise?"
"Promise." As you say it, you feel a weight go off your soul. You now know what to do now if you start feeling weird about this whole transformation thing.
